screen_desc: The screenshot shows the Google search results page on a mobile phone, with a search query for "Amazon." The top part of the screen displays a special Google logo themed with a "Go Vote!" message. The search results list various links related to Amazon, including sponsored links leading directly to Amazon's official site, deals, devices, home & kitchen products, music, and an option to sign up for Amazon Prime. The first link is highlighted as an advertisement with a rating for Amazon.com and information about the return policy. There are additional tabs available for shopping, news, books, images, videos, and maps just below the search bar.
action_think: The current screen shows Google search results for Amazon, but to clear the cart on Amazon and add a new item to it, I will need to navigate to the actual Amazon website. There is a sponsored link to the official Amazon site at the very top of the screen. Clicking on this link will direct the browser to the Amazon homepage, which is the first step in the outlined task.
action_plan: Click on the sponsored link to open the Amazon website.
Locate the cart icon and enter the cart.
Clear the cart if there are any items in it.
Search for 'razer blade' using the Amazon search bar.
Select a 'razer blade' product from the search results.
Add the 'razer blade' product to the cart.
action_desc: Click on the sponsored Amazon link at the top of the search results.
